result.execSummary:
The defendant JUSTIN W GREY was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
PAYABLE TO CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE - 30 days to pay or request a payment plan. 
Cash bond applied. 
All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 

Plus supervision fees. 
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations. 
Any other assessment and counseling as required and follow through and complete all required treatment.
No abusive contact with the child and child's mother.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. JUSTIN W GREY

records.addlTxt:
11:32 AM Prosecuting attorney Sara Matthews in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant JUSTIN W GREY in court.  Attorney Scott S. Schlough in court for JUSTIN W GREY. 
Amended complaint to be filed. 
Defendant Advised of Constitutional Rights. 
Defendant informed of charges and penalties. 
Amended Count 1, Defendant enters no contest plea. 
Added Count 2, Disorderly Conduct, Defendant enters no contest plea. 
Factual basis and probable cause found. 
Court accepts pleas as voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently made and finds defendant guilty. 

Court orders: 

Withheld sentence, 2 years probation
AODA assessment, follow through with recommended treatment
Assess
No abusive contact with child and child's mother
$886, Cash bond applied 
DNA

11:24 AM Prosecuting attorney Scott Zehr in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant JUSTIN W GREY in court.  Attorney Scott S. Schlough in court for JUSTIN W GREY. 
Received offer. 
Attorney Schlough requests continuance to review discovery. 
Bond continued.
Review hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant is ordered to report to pretrial monitoring immediately after court and must comply with pretrial monitoring conditions.
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcoholic beverages
Defendant shall not go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
No verbal or physical abuse of anyone.

11:01 AM Defendant JUSTIN W GREY in court with Attorney Scott S. Schlough.  Sheila M. Yohnk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Yohnk calls case and notes appearances
Request to modify bond from no contact to no abusive contact
Court orders bond to be modified to remove no contact provision.
Bail/bond hearing on March 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.
